qas.question: For what is cottonseed used after it is separate from the fibers?
What product is processed cottonseed oil?
What is cottonseed meal used for feed?
For what purpose are cottonseed hulls used in feed?
As what did early scientists describe gossypol ?
For what is cottonseed used after it is separate from root bark?
What product is processed cottonseed bark?
For what purpose is root bark used in feed?
As what did early scientists describe cottonseed oil?
What inhibits the development of root bark?

context: The cottonseed which remains after the cotton is ginned is used to produce <a0_0><b5_0>cottonseed oil<b5_0/><a0_0/>, which, after refining, can be consumed by humans like any other <a1_0><b6_0>vegetable oil<b6_0/>.<a1_0/> The cottonseed meal that is left generally is fed to <a2_0>ruminant livestock<a2_0/>; the gossypol remaining in the meal is toxic to monogastric animals. Cottonseed hulls can be added to dairy cattle rations for <a3_0><b7_0>roughage<b7_0/><a3_0/>. During the American slavery period, cotton root bark was used in folk remedies as an abortifacient, that is, to induce a miscarriage. <b9_0>Gossypol<b9_0/> was one of the many substances found in all parts of the cotton plant and it was described by the scientists as '<a4_0><b8_0>poisonous pigment<b8_0/><a4_0/>'. It also appears to inhibit the development of sperm or even restrict the mobility of the sperm. Also, it is thought to interfere with the menstrual cycle by restricting the release of certain hormones.
